title: Jennifer Arcuri refuses to say if she had an affair with Boris Johnson
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Jennifer Arcuri has repeatedly refused to answer when asked if she had an affair with Boris Johnson.

The American businesswoman said: ‘It’s categorically no-one’s business what private life we had or didn’t have. Boris never gave me favouritism.’

Speaking on Good Morning Britain, she said she didn’t want any answer she gave to be ‘weaponised’ agaist the prime minister.

She suggested questions about their relationship were rooted in sexism, asking Piers Morgan: ‘Would you like me to ask about your sex life?

‘The first initial reaction is to deny everything. When I saw the way I’m objectified and dragged through the press… If I had looked a different way or if I was a man, I wouldn’t be objectified this way.’

Ms Arcuri also said the Prime Minister ‘asked me to show him a few things’ on the pole she had in her London home.

The American businesswoman said: ‘It’s categorically no-one’s business what private life we had or didn’t have.’ (Picture: ITV)

Speaking on Good Morning Britain, she said she didn’t want any answer she gave to be ‘weaponised’ agaist the prime minister. (Picture: ITV)

Describing the kit as a ‘conversation starter,’ she said she and Mr Johnson ‘always had a laugh about it’.

‘The pole stood in the living room, yes, he saw the pole.’

When asked directly whether Mr Johnson had ever used the pole, Ms Arcuri said: ‘I’m never going to tell you that.’

She described how she first bonded with Boris Johnson over discussing classic literature including Shakespeare.

‘I remember just striking up a conversation about classic literature and Shakespeare and we immediately bonded,’ she said. ‘That mutual interest endeared him to me from the get go because we found something we both liked.’

She said Boris Johnson had visited her flat a ‘handful’ of times.

Jennifer Arcuri speaking on Good Morning Britain (Picture: ITV)

The technology entrepreneur and former model told ITV’s Good Morning Britain that she did not have time for the media attention surrounding Mr Johnson when they met in public.

She added: ‘We tried having drinks out in public or having lunch, it just became too much of a mob show, so I said ‘you just have to come to my office’.’

When asked, Ms Arcuri said that her office was in her Shoreditch flat.

Ms Arcuri said she had never discussed any sponsorship or grants with Mr Johnson.

When asked if she had asked Mr Johnson to help with any ‘sponsorship money’, she said: “Categorically no.”

Ms Arcuri denied ever directly asking Mr Johnson for sponsorship money.

When asked whether she had asked for money, she said: ‘Do you think I would waste his time talking about this stuff?’

She said she used £10,000 given to her firm from London and Partners, the promotional agency run by the Mayor of London, to ‘produce [an] event’ she hosted in 2013.

She said: ‘I produce good, really sexy, on-point events.’
